clues: This city is home to a famous tower that sparkles every night.
Known as the 'City of Love' and a hub for fashion and art.
fun_fact: The Eiffel Tower was supposed to be dismantled after 20 years but was saved because it was useful for radio transmissions!
Paris has only one stop sign in the entire city—most intersections rely on priority-to-the-right rules.
trivia: This city is famous for its croissants and macarons. Bon appétit!
Paris was originally a Roman city called Lutetia.

clues: This city has the busiest pedestrian crossing in the world.
You can visit an entire district dedicated to anime, manga, and gaming.
fun_fact: Tokyo was originally a small fishing village called Edo before becoming the bustling capital it is today!
More than 14 million people live in Tokyo, making it one of the most populous cities in the world.
trivia: The city has over 160,000 restaurants, more than any other city in the world.
Tokyo’s subway system is so efficient that train delays of just a few minutes come with formal apologies.

clues: Home to a green statue gifted by France in the 1800s.
Nicknamed 'The Big Apple' and known for its Broadway theaters.
fun_fact: The Statue of Liberty was originally a copper color before oxidizing to its iconic green patina.
Times Square was once called Longacre Square before being renamed in 1904.
trivia: New York City has 468 subway stations, making it one of the most complex transit systems in the world.
The Empire State Building has its own zip code: 10118.

clues: Home to Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament.
Famous for its double-decker buses and red telephone boxes.
fun_fact: The Great Fire of London in 1666 destroyed a large portion of the city.
London has over 170 museums, many of which are free to enter.
trivia: The London Underground, also known as the Tube, is the oldest underground railway network in the world.
London has more than 8 million trees, making it one of the greenest cities in Europe.

clues: Home to the Colosseum and the Vatican City.
Known for its ancient ruins and delicious pasta.
fun_fact: The Trevi Fountain is said to bring good luck if you throw a coin over your shoulder into it.
Rome was once the capital of a vast empire that spanned three continents.
trivia: The Pantheon, a Roman temple, is nearly 2,000 years old and still has the world's largest unreinforced concrete dome.
It is illegal to sit on the Spanish Steps in Rome.

clues: Home to the Sagrada Familia, a unique and unfinished basilica.
Famous for its vibrant nightlife and beautiful beaches.
fun_fact: La Rambla is a famous street in Barcelona with flower stalls, street performers, and human statues.
Barcelona is the capital of Catalonia, a region with its own distinct culture and language.
trivia: Park Güell, designed by Antoni Gaudí, offers stunning views of the city.
FC Barcelona's stadium, Camp Nou, is one of the largest football stadiums in Europe.

clues: Home to the iconic Opera House and Harbour Bridge.
Known for its beautiful beaches and relaxed lifestyle.
fun_fact: The Sydney Harbour Bridge is nicknamed 'The Coathanger' due to its shape.
Sydney is built around a large natural harbor, making it a popular destination for sailing and water sports.
trivia: Bondi Beach is one of the most famous beaches in the world.
Sydney has a population of over 5 million people.

clues: Home to the Burj Khalifa, the tallest building in the world.
Known for its luxury shopping and modern architecture.
fun_fact: Dubai is built on reclaimed land and desert.
The Dubai Mall is one of the largest shopping malls in the world.
trivia: The Palm Jumeirah is a man-made island shaped like a palm tree.
Dubai has an indoor ski resort called Ski Dubai.

clues: Known for its canals, bicycles, and historic houses.
Home to the Anne Frank House and the Rijksmuseum.
fun_fact: Amsterdam has more bicycles than residents.
The city is built on millions of wooden poles.
trivia: The canals of Amsterdam are a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Amsterdam is known for its tolerance and diversity.

clues: Home to the Forbidden City and the Great Wall of China.
Known for its rich history and traditional cuisine.
fun_fact: The Forbidden City was the imperial palace for 24 emperors during the Ming and Qing dynasties.
Beijing is known for its Peking duck.
trivia: The Temple of Heaven is a complex of Taoist buildings where emperors performed annual ceremonies.
Beijing has a population of over 21 million people.

clues: Known for its ornate temples and bustling street markets.
Home to the Grand Palace and Wat Arun.
fun_fact: Bangkok is officially known as Krung Thep Maha Nakhon.
The city is famous for its floating markets.
trivia: Thai cuisine is known for its balance of sweet, sour, salty, and spicy flavors.
Bangkok has a vibrant nightlife.

clues: Home to the Christ the Redeemer statue and Copacabana beach.
Known for its vibrant Carnival celebrations.
fun_fact: The Christ the Redeemer statue is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.
Rio is known for its samba music and dance.
trivia: Sugarloaf Mountain offers stunning views of the city.
The annual Carnival in Rio is one of the largest and most famous festivals in the world.

clues: Home to Table Mountain and the Cape of Good Hope.
Known for its diverse culture and beautiful scenery.
fun_fact: Table Mountain is a flat-topped mountain that overlooks the city.
Cape Town is known for its wine regions.
trivia: Robben Island, where Nelson Mandela was imprisoned, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Cape Town is known for its diverse wildlife, including penguins.

clues: Known for its canals, gondolas, and romantic atmosphere.
Home to St. Mark's Square and Doge's Palace.
fun_fact: Venice is built on 118 small islands connected by bridges.
The city is sinking at a rate of 1-2 millimeters per year.
trivia: Gondolas are traditional Venetian boats that are still used for transportation.
Venice is known for its glassmaking tradition.

clues: Straddles two continents, Europe and Asia.
Home to the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque.
fun_fact: Istanbul was once the capital of the Byzantine and Ottoman Empires.
The Grand Bazaar is one of the oldest and largest covered markets in the world.
trivia: Turkish coffee is a strong and flavorful coffee that is traditionally served in small cups.
Istanbul is known for its Turkish delight, a sweet treat made with sugar and starch.

clues: Home to Hollywood and the Walk of Fame.
Known for its beaches, movie studios, and celebrity culture.
fun_fact: The Hollywood sign originally read 'Hollywoodland' and was an advertisement for a real estate development.
Los Angeles is home to the Griffith Observatory, which offers stunning views of the city and the Hollywood sign.
trivia: Disneyland, the first Disney theme park, is located in Anaheim, near Los Angeles.
Los Angeles is known for its car culture and traffic.

clues: Home to the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz Island.
Known for its cable cars, Victorian architecture, and diverse neighborhoods.
fun_fact: The Golden Gate Bridge was the longest suspension bridge in the world when it was completed in 1937.
Alcatraz Island was once a notorious federal prison.
trivia: San Francisco is known for its sourdough bread and clam chowder.
The city is a major center for technology and innovation.

clues: Home to the Duomo and the Uffizi Gallery.
Known for its Renaissance art and architecture.
fun_fact: The Duomo, also known as the Florence Cathedral, has the largest brick dome ever constructed.
Florence is the birthplace of the Renaissance.
trivia: The Uffizi Gallery houses masterpieces by artists such as Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Raphael.
Florence is known for its leather goods and gelato.

clues: A modern metropolis with a rich history and vibrant culture.
Home to the Gyeongbokgung Palace and the N Seoul Tower.
fun_fact: Seoul is surrounded by mountains, offering stunning views of the city.
The city is known for its K-pop music and dramas.
trivia: The Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) between North and South Korea is located just north of Seoul.
Seoul is a major center for technology and innovation.

clues: Home to the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag Building.
Known for its history, museums, and vibrant nightlife.
fun_fact: The Berlin Wall, which once divided the city, fell in 1989.
Berlin is known for its currywurst, a popular street food.
trivia: The East Side Gallery is a preserved section of the Berlin Wall that is now covered in murals.
Berlin is a major center for art and culture.

clues: Home to the Gateway of India and Bollywood.
Known for its bustling markets and diverse cuisine.
fun_fact: Mumbai was formerly known as Bombay.
The city is home to Dhobi Ghat, an open-air laundry where clothes are washed by hand.
trivia: Mumbai is the financial capital of India.
The city is known for its street food, including vada pav and pav bhaji.

clues: Home to the CN Tower and the Royal Ontario Museum.
Known for its multiculturalism and diverse neighborhoods.
fun_fact: The CN Tower was the tallest freestanding structure in the world for 32 years.
Toronto is home to the Hockey Hall of Fame.
trivia: Niagara Falls is located just a short drive from Toronto.
Toronto is a major center for finance and business.

clues: Home to the Willis Tower and Millennium Park.
Known for its architecture, blues music, and deep-dish pizza.
fun_fact: The Willis Tower, formerly known as the Sears Tower, was the tallest building in the world for 25 years.
Chicago is known as the 'Windy City'.
trivia: The Art Institute of Chicago is one of the oldest and largest art museums in the United States.
Chicago is a major transportation hub.

clues: A modern city-state with a diverse culture and stunning skyline.
Home to the Marina Bay Sands and Gardens by the Bay.
fun_fact: Singapore is known for its strict laws and cleanliness.
The city is a major financial center.
trivia: Singapore Changi Airport is consistently ranked as one of the best airports in the world.
Singapore is a popular destination for shopping and dining.

clues: Home to the Kremlin and Red Square.
Known for its history, art, and ballet.
fun_fact: The Kremlin is a fortified complex that houses the Russian government.
Red Square is the most famous square in Moscow.
trivia: The Bolshoi Theatre is one of the most prestigious ballet companies in the world.
Moscow is home to the State Tretyakov Gallery, which houses a vast collection of Russian art.

clues: Home to the Prado Museum and the Royal Palace.
Known for its art, tapas, and flamenco dancing.
fun_fact: The Prado Museum houses one of the world's finest collections of European art.
Madrid is known for its vibrant nightlife.
trivia: The Puerta del Sol is the central square of Madrid.
Madrid is home to Real Madrid, one of the most successful football clubs in the world.

clues: Home to the Schönbrunn Palace and the Hofburg Palace.
Known for its classical music, cafes, and elegant architecture.
fun_fact: Vienna was once the capital of the Austro-Hungarian Empire.
The city is known for its Sachertorte, a chocolate cake with apricot jam.
trivia: The Vienna State Opera is one of the most famous opera houses in the world.
Vienna is a major center for music and the arts.

clues: Home to the Charles Bridge and Prague Castle.
Known for its medieval architecture and charming atmosphere.
fun_fact: The Charles Bridge is a historic bridge that spans the Vltava River.
Prague Castle is one of the largest ancient castles in the world.
trivia: Prague is known for its beer and traditional Czech cuisine.
The city is a popular destination for stag and hen parties.

clues: Home to the Belém Tower and Jerónimos Monastery.
Known for its hilly streets, colorful buildings, and fado music.
fun_fact: Lisbon was almost completely destroyed by an earthquake in 1755.
The city is known for its pastel de nata, a custard tart.
trivia: The Alfama district is the oldest and most picturesque neighborhood in Lisbon.
Lisbon is a popular destination for surfing.

clues: Home to Trinity College and the Guinness Storehouse.
Known for its friendly pubs, live music, and literary history.
fun_fact: Trinity College is the oldest university in Ireland.
The Guinness Storehouse is a popular tourist attraction where you can learn about the history of Guinness beer.
trivia: Dublin is the birthplace of writers such as James Joyce and Oscar Wilde.
The city is known for its St. Patrick's Day celebrations.

clues: Home to the Hungarian Parliament Building and Buda Castle.
Known for its thermal baths, ruin bars, and goulash.
fun_fact: Budapest is divided into two parts, Buda and Pest, by the Danube River.
The city is known for its thermal baths, which are said to have healing properties.
trivia: The Hungarian Parliament Building is one of the most impressive buildings in Europe.
Budapest is a popular destination for river cruises.

clues: Home to the Little Mermaid statue and Tivoli Gardens.
Known for its hygge lifestyle, design, and cycling culture.
fun_fact: The Little Mermaid statue is based on the fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.
Tivoli Gardens is one of the oldest amusement parks in the world.
trivia: Copenhagen is known for its smørrebrød, open-faced sandwiches.
The city is a major center for design and sustainability.

clues: Built on 14 islands connected by bridges.
Home to the Vasa Museum and the Royal Palace.
fun_fact: The Vasa Museum houses a 17th-century warship that sank on its maiden voyage.
Stockholm is known for its Nobel Prize ceremonies.
trivia: The Gamla Stan district is the old town of Stockholm and is known for its cobblestone streets and colorful buildings.
Stockholm is a major center for technology and innovation.

clues: Home to the Viking Ship Museum and the Oslofjord.
Known for its natural beauty, museums, and Scandinavian design.
fun_fact: The Viking Ship Museum houses three well-preserved Viking ships.
Oslo is surrounded by forests and mountains, offering opportunities for hiking and skiing.
trivia: The Nobel Peace Prize is awarded annually in Oslo.
Oslo is a major center for maritime industries.

clues: Home to the Suomenlinna Fortress and the Temppeliaukio Church.
Known for its saunas, design, and coffee culture.
fun_fact: Suomenlinna Fortress is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Helsinki is known for its Alvar Aalto architecture.
trivia: Finland is known as the 'Land of a Thousand Lakes'.
Helsinki is a major center for technology and innovation.

clues: Home to the Acropolis and the Parthenon.
Known for its ancient ruins, history, and mythology.
fun_fact: The Acropolis is a hilltop citadel that houses several ancient Greek temples.
Athens is considered the birthplace of democracy.
trivia: The Parthenon is a temple dedicated to the goddess Athena.
Athens is a popular destination for history buffs and archaeology enthusiasts.

clues: A holy city for Judaism, Christianity, and Islam.
Home to the Western Wall, the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, and the Dome of the Rock.
fun_fact: The Western Wall is the holiest site in Judaism.
Jerusalem is one of the oldest cities in the world.
trivia: The Church of the Holy Sepulchre is believed to be the site of Jesus' crucifixion and resurrection.
The Dome of the Rock is an Islamic shrine located on the Temple Mount.

clues: Home to the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx.
Known for its ancient history, bustling markets, and vibrant culture.
fun_fact: The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Cairo is the largest city in Africa.
trivia: The Sphinx is a mythical creature with the head of a human and the body of a lion.
Cairo is home to the Egyptian Museum, which houses a vast collection of ancient Egyptian artifacts.

clues: Known for its bustling souks, vibrant colors, and delicious cuisine.
Home to the Djemaa el-Fna square and the Koutoubia Mosque.
fun_fact: Marrakech is known as the 'Red City' due to the color of its buildings.
The city is a popular destination for shopping and exploring the souks.
trivia: Djemaa el-Fna square is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Marrakech is known for its traditional Moroccan crafts, such as carpets and leather goods.

clues: Home to the Palacio de Bellas Artes and the Zócalo.
Known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and delicious street food.
fun_fact: Mexico City was built on the ruins of the Aztec capital, Tenochtitlan.
The city is known for its lucha libre wrestling.
trivia: The Palacio de Bellas Artes is a beautiful Art Nouveau building that houses a theater and museum.
Mexico City is a major center for art and culture.

clues: Home to the Obelisco and the Teatro Colón.
Known for its tango dancing, European-tyle architecture, and vibrant nightlife.
fun_fact: Buenos Aires is known as the 'Paris of South America'.
The city is home to La Boca, a colorful neighborhood known for its tango culture.
trivia: The Obelisco is a national monument located in the center of Buenos Aires.
Buenos Aires is a major center for fashion and design.

clues: Known for its vintage cars, colorful buildings, and revolutionary history.
Home to the Malecón and the Plaza de la Revolución.
fun_fact: Havana is known for its salsa music and cigars.
The city has a unique blend of Spanish and Caribbean influences.
trivia: The Malecón is a seawall that stretches for 8 kilometers along the coast.
Havana is a popular destination for classic car enthusiasts.

clues: The northernmost capital city in the world.
Known for its geothermal pools, the Northern Lights, and stunning landscapes.
fun_fact: Reykjavik is powered by geothermal energy.
The city is known for its vibrant music scene.
trivia: The Blue Lagoon is a geothermal spa located near Reykjavik.
Iceland is home to active volcanoes and glaciers.

clues: Known as the 'City of Sails'.
Home to the Sky Tower and the Auckland Domain.
fun_fact: Auckland is built on a volcanic field.
The city is known for its Maori culture.
trivia: The Sky Tower is the tallest freestanding structure in the Southern Hemisphere.
Auckland is a popular destination for outdoor activities, such as sailing and hiking.

clues: The capital of Hawaii.
Known for its beaches, surfing, and Polynesian culture.
fun_fact: Honolulu is home to Pearl Harbor, a historic naval base.
The city is known for its lei, a garland of flowers given as a symbol of welcome.
trivia: Waikiki Beach is one of the most famous beaches in the world.
Honolulu is a popular destination for honeymoons and family vacations.

clues: Surrounded by mountains and the Pacific Ocean.
Known for its natural beauty, outdoor activities, and diverse culture.
fun_fact: Vancouver is home to Stanley Park, one of the largest urban parks in North America.
The city is known for its sushi and seafood.
trivia: Vancouver hosted the 2010 Winter Olympics.
The city is a major center for film and television production.

clues: The former capital of Japan.
Known for its temples, gardens, and traditional culture.
fun_fact: Kyoto is home to over 1,600 Buddhist temples.
The city is known for its geisha district, Gion.
trivia: Kinkaku-ji, also known as the Golden Pavilion, is a Zen temple covered in gold leaf.
Kyoto is a popular destination for cherry blossom viewing in the spring.

clues: Home to the Taj Mahal, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
Known for its Mughal architecture and history.
fun_fact: The Taj Mahal was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
Agra is known for its marble inlay work.
trivia: The Agra Fort is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Agra is a popular destination for history buffs and architecture enthusiasts.

clues: Known as the 'Pink City' due to the color of its buildings.
Home to the Hawa Mahal and the Amber Fort.
fun_fact: Jaipur was painted pink in 1876 to welcome Prince Albert.
The city is known for its textiles and jewelry.
trivia: The Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Winds, is a unique building with 953 windows.
Jaipur is a popular destination for cultural experiences.

clues: Home to the Boudhanath Stupa and Pashupatinath Temple.
Known for its Himalayan views, trekking, and spiritual atmosphere.
fun_fact: Kathmandu is the gateway to the Himalayas.
The city is known for its momos, steamed dumplings.
trivia: Mount Everest, the highest mountain in the world, is located in Nepal.
Kathmandu is a popular destination for adventure seekers and spiritual travelers.

clues: A volcanic island with whitewashed buildings and blue-domed churches.
Known for its stunning sunsets and romantic atmosphere.
fun_fact: Santorini is part of a caldera, a volcanic crater formed by a massive eruption.
The island is known for its wine production.
trivia: Oia is a village on Santorini that is famous for its sunsets.
Santorini is a popular destination for honeymoons and couples.

clues: A UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Known for its temples, monks, and laid-back atmosphere.
fun_fact: Luang Prabang was once the royal capital of Laos.
The city is known for its alms giving ceremony, where monks collect food from locals.
trivia: The Kuang Si Falls are a beautiful waterfall located near Luang Prabang.
Luang Prabang is a popular destination for those seeking a peaceful and cultural experience.

clues: The capital of Vietnam.
Known for its French colonial architecture, bustling streets, and delicious street food.
fun_fact: Hanoi is home to Hoan Kiem Lake, a scenic lake in the heart of the city.
The city is known for its pho, a noodle soup.
trivia: The Temple of Literature is a Confucian temple dedicated to scholars and learning.
Hanoi is a popular destination for those seeking a cultural experience.

clues: A UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Known for its ancient town, tailor shops, and lanterns.
fun_fact: Hoi An was once a major trading port.
The city is known for its beautiful beaches.
trivia: The Japanese Covered Bridge is a historic landmark in Hoi An.
Hoi An is a popular destination for those seeking a relaxing and cultural experience.

clues: Home to Angkor Wat, a vast temple complex.
Known for its ancient ruins, temples, and Apsara dancing.
fun_fact: Angkor Wat is the largest religious monument in the world.
Siemp Reap is a popular destination for those seeking a cultural and historical experience.
trivia: Angkor Thom is another impressive temple complex near Siemp Reap.
Cambodia is known for its friendly people and delicious cuisine.
